definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: I. Love sums up the whole Law.
sentences.chinese: 愛人如己是一切律法的總綱。

sentences.english: The second is this: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 其次，就是說，要愛人如己。

sentences.english: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, [even] in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
sentences.chinese: 因爲全律法都包在愛人如己這一句話之內了。

sentences.english: And we can show how much we love our country by loving our neighbors as ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以愛人如己的方式，熱愛我們的國家。

sentences.english: K. Love sums up the whole Law.
sentences.chinese: 愛人如己是一切律法的總綱。

sentences.english: Christ exhorted us to love one another.
sentences.chinese: 基督勸告我們要愛人如己。

sentences.english: Do I love my neighbor as myself?
Love your neighbor as yourself, you know, I the Lord am your God.
sentences.chinese: 愛人如己，我是耶和華，你的神。

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
